good evening ladies and gentlemen it is

I hope it will be of some interest and

the only area of spiritual practice and

there's a transition into something new
quite often the lay Community will

a ceremony in which the lay people make

then recite a number of discourses of

chanter discourses is what is called the
mahamangala sutta mangala is a word that
is a little difficult to translate
because it is in Pali Pali was the
language spoken we think
in the Ganges Valley around the time of

ago 2 600 years ago but it was a spoken

version of Sanskrit one could say and it
is the language in which the therabada
cannon or scriptures are preserved so
when monks perform ceremonies and they
do chanting they often chant in this
Pali language
and this is one of the discourses that
is very popular throughout the Buddhist
communities of in particular Southeast
Asia
and it is an interesting discourse of
the Buddha because it does have some
very important
guidelines for how we may approach life
in order to gain
well-being happiness and success
now
the word mangala can often be translated

not because it is unknown but because

there is this deep-seated
